problem.prob_desc:
25. 양의 실수 전체의 집합에서 정의되고 미분가능한 두 함수 $f(x),\ g(x)$가 있다. $g(x)$는 $f(x)$의 역함수이고, $g'(x)$는 양의 실수 전체의 집합에서 연속이다. 모든 양수 $a$에 대하여 $$\int_{1}^{a} \frac{1}{g’(f(x))\,f(x)} \, dx = 2\ln a + \ln(a + 1) - \ln 2$$이고 $f(1)=8$일 때, $f(2)$의 값은? [3점]
① 36 ② 40 ③ 44 ④ 48 ⑤ 52

gpt-5-codex.title: Relate integral to f
gpt-5-codex.body: Since g is the inverse of f, we have g(f(x)) = x. Differentiating gives g'(f(x)) · f'(x) = 1, so g'(f(x)) = 1/f'(x). Therefore, the integrand becomes 1/(g'(f(x)) f(x)) = f'(x)/f(x), whose integral over [1, a] equals ln f(a) − ln f(1).

gpt-5-codex.title: Determine f(a)
gpt-5-codex.body: Matching ln f(a) − ln f(1) = 2 ln a + ln(a + 1) − ln 2 and exponentiating yields f(a)/f(1) = a^2(a + 1)/2. With f(1) = 8, we get f(a) = 4a^2(a + 1).

gpt-5-codex.title: Evaluate f(2)
gpt-5-codex.body: Substituting a = 2 into f(a) gives f(2) = 4·2^2·(2 + 1) = 4·4·3 = 48.

gpt-5.title: Relate derivatives of inverses
gpt-5.body: Since g is the inverse of f on positive reals, g(f(x)) = x. Differentiating gives g'(f(x))·f'(x) = 1, hence g'(f(x)) = 1 / f'(x). Therefore the integrand becomes 1 / (g'(f(x)) f(x)) = f'(x)/f(x).

gpt-5.title: Integrate the simplified integrand
gpt-5.body: ∫_{1}^{a} f'(x)/f(x) dx = ln f(a) − ln f(1). Given f(1) = 8, the left side equals ln f(a) − ln 8.

gpt-5.title: Solve for f(a) and evaluate f(2)
gpt-5.body: Given ∫_{1}^{a} ... dx = 2 ln a + ln(a+1) − ln 2 = ln(a^2(a+1)/2). Thus ln f(a) − ln 8 = ln(a^2(a+1)/2), so ln f(a) = ln(8·a^2(a+1)/2) = ln(4a^2(a+1)), hence f(a) = 4a^2(a+1). Therefore f(2) = 4·4·3 = 48.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Simplify the integrand using inverse function properties
claude-opus-4.5.body:
Since g(x) is the inverse function of f(x), we have g(f(x)) = x.

Differentiating both sides: g'(f(x)) · f'(x) = 1

Therefore: g'(f(x)) = 1/f'(x)

The integrand becomes:
1/(g'(f(x)) · f(x)) = 1/((1/f'(x)) · f(x)) = f'(x)/f(x)

claude-opus-4.5.title: Evaluate the integral
claude-opus-4.5.body:
∫₁ᵃ f'(x)/f(x) dx = [ln|f(x)|]₁ᵃ = ln(f(a)) - ln(f(1))

Since f(1) = 8:
ln(f(a)) - ln(8) = 2ln(a) + ln(a+1) - ln(2)

claude-opus-4.5.title: Solve for f(a)
claude-opus-4.5.body:
ln(f(a)) = ln(8) + 2ln(a) + ln(a+1) - ln(2)
ln(f(a)) = ln(8) + ln(a²) + ln(a+1) - ln(2)
ln(f(a)) = ln(8a²(a+1)/2)
ln(f(a)) = ln(4a²(a+1))

Therefore: f(a) = 4a²(a+1)

gemini-3-pro.title: Simplify the integrand using the inverse function derivative property
gemini-3-pro.body:
Since $g(x)$ is the inverse function of $f(x)$, we have $g(f(x)) = x$. Differentiating both sides with respect to $x$ gives $g'(f(x)) \cdot f'(x) = 1$, which implies $g'(f(x)) = \frac{1}{f'(x)}$. Substituting this into the integrand, the expression becomes:
\[ \frac{1}{g'(f(x)) \cdot f(x)} = \frac{1}{\frac{1}{f'(x)} \cdot f(x)} = \frac{f'(x)}{f(x)} \]

gemini-3-pro.title: Evaluate the integral and solve for f(a)
gemini-3-pro.body:
We evaluate the definite integral:
\[ \int_{1}^{a}  rac{f'(x)}{f(x)} \, dx = [\ln(f(x))]_{1}^{a} = \ln(f(a)) - \ln(f(1)) \]
Using the given condition $f(1) = 8$ and the given equation:
\[ \ln(f(a)) - \ln 8 = 2\ln a + \ln(a+1) - \ln 2 \]
Rearranging the terms using properties of logarithms:
\[ \ln(f(a)) = \ln(a^2) + \ln(a+1) - \ln 2 + \ln 8 \]
\[ \ln(f(a)) = \ln\left(a^2 \cdot (a+1) \cdot \frac{8}{2}\right) = \ln(4a^2(a+1)) \]
Thus, $f(a) = 4a^2(a+1)$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Calculate the value of f(2)
gemini-3-pro.body:
Substitute $a = 2$ into the expression for $f(a)$ derived in the previous step:
\[ f(2) = 4(2^2)(2+1) \]
\[ f(2) = 4 \cdot 4 \cdot 3 = 48 \]

grok-4-fast.title: Simplify integrand using inverse function derivative
grok-4-fast.body: Since g is the inverse of f, g'(f(x)) = 1 / f'(x). Thus, the integrand 1 / (g'(f(x)) f(x)) = 1 / ((1/f'(x)) f(x)) = f'(x) / f(x).

grok-4-fast.title: Evaluate the definite integral
grok-4-fast.body: The integral ∫ from 1 to a of [f'(x) / f(x)] dx = ln f(a) - ln f(1) = ln(f(a)/f(1)). Given f(1) = 8, this is ln(f(a)/8).

grok-4-fast.title: Set up equation with right-hand side
grok-4-fast.body: So ln(f(a)/8) = 2 ln a + ln(a+1) - ln 2 = ln(a^2 (a+1)/2). Therefore, f(a)/8 = a^2 (a+1)/2, and f(a) = 4 a^2 (a+1).
